reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: Enhanced livelihoods and value chains for farmers' organizations in Mozambique Nepal and Tanzania
Viljelijajarjestojen arvoketjuihin pohjautuvien elinkeinojen edistaminen Mosambikissa ja Tansaniassa

description.narrative: The project builds on FFDs partnerships with three smallholder farmers organizations in Africa and Asia. The FOs are: Aniwanana Kanvanhiana Comercial (AKA) in Mozambique Sundardeep Women Fish Farmers Cooperative in Nepal and Njombe Agricultural Development Organisation (NADO) in Tanzania. The planned impact is: Improved and resilient livelihoods of AKA Sundardeep and NADO members. The project has three country-specific outcomes namely: 1. Improved service delivery of AKA and capacities of its members in cli mate-smart agricultural production and value chain development (Mozambique) 2. Improved service delivery of Sundardeep and seven other FOs and capacities of their members in climate-smart aquaculture production and value chain development (Nepal) and 3. Im proved service delivery of NADO and capacities of its members in climate-smart potato production and value chain development (Tanzania). For each outcome a few concrete outputs focusing on the capacity development of the FO its member organizations and me mbers of the groups (men women) have been designed addressing their organizational technical (farming) and value chain development needs.The project focuses on gender equality working towards the fulfilment of equal rights to the benefits and income arisin g from fish farming crop production and cooperative development. The project addresses existing institutional and organizational gaps at the FO and cooperative/group level. The project has nearly 6000 direct beneficiaries (agricultural producers potato far mers fish farmers and staff and elected leadership of local FOs). It supports more than 240 cooperatives unions producer associations and farmers or fish farmers groups. There are 28 000 final beneficiaries. The project is fully aligned with the national d evelopment policies in Mozambique Nepal and Tanzania. It contributes to the achievement of several priority areas of Government of Finland Development Policy 2016 and the Country Strategies in Mozambique Nepal and Tanzania. The project is human rights sens itive. Gender equality reduction of inequalities and climate sustainability are addressed in all sub-projects.

participating-org.narrative: Finnish Agri-Agency for Food and Forest Development ry
Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

activity-date.narrative: Actual start date of the activity
Planned end date of the activity

tag.narrative: Generating jobs, livelihood opportunities and well-being in a developing country is the main prio rity area in this activity
Improving food security, access to water and sustainability is the secondary priority area in t his activity
Strengthening of the rights and status of women and girls is a secondary priority area in this activity
